intro: Vellozia prolifera, commonly known as the African rock orchid, is a striking plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the orchid family and is characterized by its unique, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Vellozia prolifera is known for its ability to form dense clusters, with stems that can produce numerous small, showy blooms. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticulture and ecological studies.
